meanings.definition: To change the order or arrangement of (a set of items)
meanings.sent1: I will permute the numbers to see if a different pattern emerges.
meanings.sent2: It is common in math to permute the digits to solve the problem.
meanings.sent3: Trying to permute the colors of the rainbow in a new way can be quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: Her mind seemed to permute the memories, creating a unique blend of past experiences.
meanings.sent5: The artist's goal was to permute the shapes in the painting to evoke different emotions.

meanings.definition: To alter the sequence of (a set of elements)
meanings.sent1: Let's permute the order of the songs in the playlist for a fresh listening experience.
meanings.sent2: The software allows users to easily permute the data for analysis.
meanings.sent3: He decided to permute the ingredients in the recipe just for fun.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to permute reality itself with his mesmerizing tricks.
meanings.sent5: The wind seemed to permute the sand dunes into ever-changing shapes.
